Original Requirements: Create a snake game in Python
Product Goals: Create an engaging and interactive user experience for the snake game
Improve the game's performance and responsiveness
Enhance the game's visual appeal with simple yet effective graphics
User Stories: As a player, I want to be able to control the snake using arrow keys
As a player, I want to see my current score displayed on the screen
As a player, I want to be notified when the game is over and have the option to restart
As a player, I want the game to generate food at random positions on the board
As a player, I want the snake to grow longer when it consumes food
Competitive Analysis: Snake Game A: Simple graphics, lacks smooth animations
Slither.io: Engaging multiplayer mode, but limited single-player features
Snake Game B: Basic gameplay, lacks variety in levels or power-ups
Agar.io: Unique gameplay mechanics, but not a traditional snake game
Classic Snake: Timeless gameplay, but outdated graphics and sound effects

Requirement Analysis: The game requires a grid-based system for the snake to move around in, with the ability to generate food at random positions. The snake should be able to grow longer when it consumes food, and the game should end when the snake collides with the boundaries or its own body. A scoring system should be implemented to track the player's progress.
Requirement Pool: Implement a grid-based game board with a size of 10x10
Create a snake object that can move around the board using arrow keys
Generate food at random positions on the board
Implement collision detection for the snake with boundaries and its own body
Add a scoring system to track the player's progress
UI Design draft: The game will feature a simple grid-based layout, with the snake and food represented by basic shapes. The current score will be displayed at the top of the screen, and a game over message will appear when the game ends.
Anything UNCLEAR: The project requirements do not specify any particular graphics or sound effects, so these aspects will need to be decided upon during development.
